programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: An epic stretch of Scottish coastline is the first stop for Michael Portillo. Siccar Point, close to Dunbar on the Firth of Forth, was the site of an extraordinary 18th-century discovery and is today a place of pilgrimage for earth scientists.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his 300-mile Scottish coastal journey along the Firth of Forth at the railway engineering icon for which it is famous throughout the world - the Forth Bridge.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his Scottish railway journey in the beautiful medieval city of Stirling. Michael learns it was a strategic city, situated where the Lowlands meet the Highlands at the lowest bridging point of the River Forth.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Leuchars, known today on the railways as Leuchars for St Andrews. Scotlands oldest university, St Andrews is located on a beautiful beachfront.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys faces light up when they stumble on a warehouse packed with vintage searchlights. Frank risks it all for a game of Space Invaders.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank run amok when they find rare relics that deserve to be on display in a museum.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have their work cut out for them when they run into some kid pickers who drive a hard bargain and show them how well they can negotiate.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien head to Newark. Simon finds an antique European threshing board, which he turns into a coffee table and Henrys all at sea with a ships porthole.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry finds a treat for restorer Guy, and Simon creates stunning table lamps from old theatre lights.

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Fowler faces the stress of student rag week, DI Grim is in a happy mood as he takes on bank robbers, and DC Kray fancies a kebab.

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Surrounded by juvenile delinquents at the station, Sgt Dawkins must cope with Inspector Fowlers visiting son at home.

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Fowler doesnt get the lead in an amateur drama groups annual pageant, and Grim and Kray track down brutal carolers.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Focusing on the 11th century building programme undertaken by the Normans, which resulted in impressive fortress cathedrals at Peterborough and Ely and a magnificent castle in Rochester.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred investigates the construction of the great chain of castles of North Wales, revealing the building techniques and the defensive features that helped Edwards I subdue the rebellious Welsh.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred looks at how carpenters have used their talents to transform buildings such as Stockey Castle, Little Moreton Hall and Harvington Hall.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred focuses on Scottish baronial style. At Glamis Castle, Fred reveals how a simple sandstone tower house was transformed with the help of stonemasons from Aberdeen and plasterers from Italy. In addition, he visits the house of Dun near Montrose and Culezean Castle on the Ayshire coast.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah takes his series on the building of Britain to his home turf - Lancashire - so he can wax lyrical over the roots of the nations canal network. He visits Worsley to see where it all began and, in his own back garden, and demonstrates the early canal-building process. Fred then takes a trip on the Leeds-Liverpool waterway, revealing the hard work and skill that made such a passage possible.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah shows how steam-powered machinery helped build Herefordshires Eastnor Castle, and takes a look at the work of Augustus Welby Pugin, the architect whose buildings - such as the Palace of Westminster - were inspired by medieval gothic architecture.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: An artistic dispute with the Meldrews threatens to scupper Patricks plans for a quiet birthday, and Pippa finds herself in an adulterous affair.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor wades through four nightmares, first with a local theatre group, then with his new car, digestive troubles and Mildreds accidental death.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Katy the cleaner writes a play about her larger-than-life employers, and Mrs Warboys has an unspeakable ordeal in the Meldews bathroom.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: A sweltering summers night during a power cut proves to be a time for Victor and Margaret to reflect on their lives, hopes, and fears.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victors decision to take up fishing leads to an encounter with Man at his most primitive. Patricks gay twin brother Nigel comes to stay.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is invited to a pitiful school reunion, and is struck down by a speeding car on his way home. As Margarets new friend comforts her, events are revealed in flashback. Will she take revenge?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave picks up a 1970s Alfa Romeo that once starred in a chocolate advert. Meanwhile, Derek casts his eye over a Citroen 2CV before becoming distracted by a treasure trove of more than 270 motorbikes in the same garage.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads off to acquire some vintage motorcycles from a collection in a garage at the bottom of a garden in the North East. Meanwhile, Paul tries to bag a 1955 Ford Zephyr convertible.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Sunderland to pick up a real Italian beauty - a 1972 Lancia Fulvia Zagato. Red and racy, the car has seen better days, but Dereks still impressed.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Up for sale at the Mathewsons auction is a 1275 Mini GT thats come from just down the road and could be a future British icon.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: One of Fred Dibnahs passions was restoring engines and chimneys. Amongst his triumphs was his steam traction engine, lovingly restored over 27 years.

programme.title: Paras
programme.desc: Dharam Singh is a honest farmer in rural India and lives with his sister Bela. One day both siblings witness a murder and drag the murderer down to the police station. However, what they do not realise is that the murderer is the brother of the influential Arjun Singh and that their decision to turn him in will change everything.

programme.title: Alif
programme.desc: Hakim wants his 10-year-old son Ali to become a doctor. However, he faces backlash from his family and neighbours who want Ali to become a scholar of Quran. Things change after Hakims sister arrives.

programme.title: Ishwar Sakshi
programme.desc: A man promises to marry his daughter to a young man in front of a statue of Vishnu as his witness. Later the father refuses and the young man appeals to Vishnu for help.

programme.title: Chalte Chalte
programme.desc: A prim and proper fashion designer is attracted to an impulsive man after running into him on a highway.

programme.title: Lamhe
programme.desc: Viren falls in love at first sight when he sees the beautiful Pallavi, but is too shy to let her know his feelings. He then realises she is in love with Siddharth, whom she goes on to marry. When Pallavi and Siddharth die in a car crash, Viren takes charge of their daughter Pooja. As the years pass, Viren and Pooja fall in love, but Viren is not prepared to accept his feelings for a girl so much younger than himself.

programme.title: Mujhse Shaadi Karogi
programme.desc: Sameer is a quick-tempered young man who is shipped off to Goa after losing his temper and getting kicked out of school.
